definitionGroups.group: (informal) Merchandise (“goods which are or were offered or intended for sale”).

entries.meaning: (especially in entertainment, sports, marketing) Merchandise (“goods connected with an entity such as a team, band, work of fiction, etc”).
examples: Many musicians make merch you can only get if you join the fanclub.

verbs.description: merch (third-person singular simple present merches, present participle merching, simple past and past participle merched)

examples: Maligned by rockers, misunderstood by critics, and merched by Madison Avenue, rave may be the only vital youth culture remaining.
